countries.name: United States

legislation.name: America's AI Action Plan (July 2025)
legislation.description: 90+ policy actions across innovation, infrastructure, and international diplomacy

legislation.name: Executive Order 14148 (January 2025)
legislation.description: "Removing Barriers to American Leadership in AI" - revoked Biden's comprehensive approach

legislation.name: NIST AI Risk Management Framework
legislation.description: Voluntary framework widely referenced despite deregulatory pivot

highlights: Market-first approach emphasizing deregulation and export promotion
Congress defeated federal preemption efforts 99-1, preserving state authority
Heavy reliance on voluntary standards and existing legal frameworks
Penalties enforced by existing agencies (FTC, FDA) under current laws
countries.details: Market-first approach emphasizing deregulation and export promotion. States retain authority after Congress defeated federal preemption 99-1.

countries.name: European Union
countries.statusText: Active - World's First Comprehensive AI Law

legislation.name: EU AI Act (Regulation 2024/1689)
legislation.description: World's first comprehensive AI regulatory framework with four-tier risk classification system

legislation.name: General-Purpose AI Code of Practice
legislation.description: Detailed compliance guidance for frontier AI models (effective July 2025)

highlights: Human-centric AI prioritizing fundamental rights and democracy
Mandatory conformity assessments for high-risk AI systems
GPAI models >10^25 FLOPs require systemic risk evaluations
Integration with existing product safety regulations
countries.details: Four-tier risk classification system with human-centric AI prioritizing fundamental rights and democracy.

countries.name: China

legislation.name: New Generation AI Development Plan (2017)
legislation.description: National strategy targeting global AI leadership by 2030

legislation.name: Interim Measures for Generative AI Services (2023)
legislation.description: First specific regulation on generative AI with security assessment requirements

legislation.name: AI Content Labeling Rules (2025)
legislation.description: Mandatory labeling of all AI-generated content effective September 2025

highlights: Algorithm registry system with 238 generative AI services filed
Integration with social credit and data governance systems
"Crossroads Era" triggered by DeepSeek's breakthrough in AI capabilities
Mandatory AI content labeling effective September 2025
countries.details: Algorithm registry with 238 services, content control, integration with social credit systems. "Crossroads Era" with DeepSeek breakthrough.

countries.name: Japan

legislation.name: AI Promotion Act (May 2025)
legislation.description: First AI-specific legislation focused entirely on promoting innovation without restrictions

highlights: Technological neutrality relying on existing sector-specific laws
Leads G7 Hiroshima AI Process establishing international guiding principles
No penalties, emphasizing cooperation between government and industry
countries.details: First AI-specific legislation focused entirely on promoting innovation. Leads G7 Hiroshima AI Process.

countries.name: South Korea

legislation.name: AI Framework Act (December 2024)
legislation.description: First comprehensive AI legislation in Asia-Pacific, effective January 2026

highlights: Risk-based framework distinguishing "high-impact AI" in critical sectors
Integration of AI governance with data protection reform
"Top 3 Global AI Strategy" backed by significant government investment
countries.details: Risk-based framework targeting 70% corporate AI deployment by 2030. Integration with data protection reform.

countries.name: Singapore

legislation.name: Model AI Governance Framework (2024)
legislation.description: Covers both traditional and generative AI with nine trust dimensions

legislation.name: AI Verify Foundation
legislation.description: Global open-source community for AI testing tool development

highlights: World's first comprehensive AI governance testing toolkit
Successful mapping to US NIST frameworks demonstrating international interoperability
Global AI Assurance Pilot with multicultural red teaming exercises
countries.details: World's first comprehensive AI governance testing toolkit. Global AI Assurance Pilot with 9 APAC countries.

countries.name: United Kingdom

legislation.name: AI Opportunities Action Plan (January 2025)
legislation.description: Emphasizing economic growth over regulatory constraints

highlights: Post-Brexit regulatory autonomy distinct from EU AI Act
Cross-sector framework relying on existing regulators
AI Growth Zones with enhanced infrastructure support
countries.details: Post-Brexit regulatory autonomy. AI Growth Zones with enhanced infrastructure. Cross-sector framework.

countries.name: Canada

legislation.name: AI Strategy for Federal Public Service 2025-2027
legislation.description: First comprehensive AI strategy for federal government operations (March 2025)

legislation.name: Directive on Automated Decision-Making
legislation.description: Mandatory Algorithmic Impact Assessments with peer review for higher-risk systems

highlights: Human-centric collaborative governance approach
Most advanced government AI accountability framework globally
Federal-provincial coordination while preserving jurisdictional boundaries
countries.details: Most advanced government AI accountability framework globally. 84 stakeholder consultations with Indigenous partnership.

countries.name: Australia

legislation.name: Policy for Responsible Use of AI in Government
legislation.description: Mandatory requirements for all Commonwealth entities (September 2024)

legislation.name: National Framework for Assurance of AI in Government
legislation.description: Consistent approach across federal, state, and territory levels

highlights: Government as exemplar in responsible AI use
Mandatory designation of Accountable Officials
Public AI transparency statements with clear reporting requirements
countries.details: Mandatory Accountable Officials and public transparency statements. Consistent federal-state framework.

countries.name: India

legislation.name: IndiaAI Mission (March 2024)
legislation.description: Emphasizing "#AIForAll" inclusive development approach

legislation.name: AI Governance Guidelines (January 2025)
legislation.description: Recommend Inter-Ministerial AI Coordination Committee

highlights: Indigenous AI model development with multilingual capabilities
Positioning as "AI Garage" for developing world applications
Whole-of-government approach with harm mitigation as core principle

investment.title: IndiaAI Mission Investment
investment.details: One of the largest national AI investments globally

countries.details: #AIForAll approach. 18,000 AI compute units. Positioning as "AI Garage" for developing world.

countries.name: Brazil

legislation.name: Senate-Approved AI Bill (December 2024)
legislation.description: Risk-based framework similar to EU AI Act with three tiers

highlights: Risk-based framework with significant enforcement mechanisms
Regulatory sandboxes for controlled experimentation
Santos Dumont supercomputer development program
countries.details: EU AI Act-similar framework with 3 risk tiers. Regulatory sandboxes for experimentation.

countries.name: United Arab Emirates

legislation.name: National AI Strategy 2031
legislation.description: Comprehensive framework with world's first Minister of State for AI (2017)

legislation.name: International Stance on AI Policy (October 2024)
legislation.description: Six core principles for international AI governance

highlights: Regulatory Intelligence Office using AI to draft legislation
Early adoption of ISO/IEC 42001:2023 AI management systems standard
Government-led comprehensive planning with 70% acceleration targets
countries.details: World's first AI Minister (2017). Regulatory Intelligence Office using AI to draft legislation 70% faster.
